reviews.text: This museum was one of the highlights of my month long trip to Laos. Especially if you are heading up north, this museum will have excellent information to have a base of knowledge for village visits. Free tours on Tuesdays and Thursdays (?), at three pm. The guide spoke fluent English and even answered questions that were not in the original tour. It is worth paying for this kind of tour on other days too. For crafts enthusiasts this museum is a must! The shop is nicely organised and has beautiful handicrafts.

The museum itself was nice and informative but I felt that the admission fee of 25K was a bit high for the size of this museum. That said, you could learn about the different minorities that dominate Laos, and this museum focuses on a few of them and showcases their culture. 

Would recommend this place to anyone who's interested in culture.

Absolutely worth a visit! One of the only places I would describe as a museum in Laos, and very interesting and informative at that. While it isn't very large, it is still gives more information on the culture of Laos than pretty much anywhere else we went. They also have a gift shop with hand made items, which is also worth a visit. Highly recommend.

This is a wee gem of a museum and really worth visiting. For an entrance fee of only 20000 kip (about €2) you will be treated to a colourful and informative display of the clothing, language and culture of the various ethnic groups in Laos. There are some great audio snippets too and the exhibition of traditional instruments is well worth checking out  The centre also runs workshops in embroidery and basket making at a very reasonable price of $12 for a half day workshop

Entrance 25000kat (could be cheaper) 
I enjoyed the place as it has collection of facts about local people. The entertainment  includes music which you can hear via provided headphones and some things to play with and think about changing of our world. 
Great work of curator 
You can also visit some workshops 
Shop could be better though, plus would be great to have a place for coffee there  
Also there is useful information how to understand quality of handmade and fabric things in the shops here

It was OK. You can go into the grounds and see the temple for free but must buy a ticket for 30k to visit the palace itself. No history about what happened to the palace/family. An audio tour would have been helpful. No shoes or phones allowed inside. Quite expensive for what was essentially a quick walk around of a small old palace to see a few gifts the king received.

The National Museum is basically not more than a reflection of the gifts the King got, the rooms he and his family lived in and some clothes he was wearing.
All is nicely arranged actually. However, if you miss it, no need to worry.

We couldn't enter the Palace as it was already closed. Enjoyed the walk around the grounds. Note you have to leave bags etc at the locker room across the lawns at the Theatre Hall. No photographs inside either.
This is a review for the Lao traditional dance performance that happens a few times a week. It’s amazing! The dancers are fascinating, the music is excellent and the experience overall is great!

You can't take bags inside, they make you leave them in an insecure locker room. Not cool if you are a long term traveller and need to keep your valuables inc passport etc on you at all times. What's more they don't make this apparent until after you've bought a ticket, so this place is basically a scam

One of good temples complex that have good parking lot and wide area for moving around. Many beautiful temples, some are bigger than other. You can go inside and see the statues and reliefs. It's also actively used as a praying area so the tourist better keep a comfortable distance. It's also strategic with many shops in town and can be reached by walk or bicycling. Better bring your own drinking bottle, because it's hot. #letsguide #temples #tourism #localguides
Beautiful temple with amazingly well decorated exteriors. Definitely worth a visit even if it's for 15 minutes!
Well done and fairly well preserved temple. I love this city because it's so charming and walkable and there are a plentittude of sites all withing walking distance of old town.

The gorgeous temple that you should to come when you come to Luang phabang.
Mosaic and painting are unique and beautiful.

Admission fee 20,000 kip
Wat Xiengthong is one of the famous temple and oldest than others that people here are almost know that and could be most beautiful temple for local people in this town.

More impressive as you approach from the boat than inside. I have seen much better and bigger with amazing crystals, water, etc. Visited both the upper and lower caves, if you are not in reasonable shape, going up can be difficult.
Not really worth one hour visit. Maybe if it's part of a tour you should go, but don't waste your time.

Very cool experience seeing hundreds of Buddhist statues inside of a cave.  Yes the 7 stairs you walk up are a bit steep once your inside of the cave, but what do you really expect in a thousand year old cave? It's worth seeing absolutely.

Only take the boat here since driving is not worth it. The boat ride was the highlight of the Pak Ou Caves. This is very much a tourist destination. On the stairs to the caves, locals will try to sell you items as well as try to get you to pay money to release birds from tiny cages. It is very unfortunate how people are abusing this spiritual site for personal gain at the expense of innocent birds.

It's ok if it's part of a tour and it's included in your package, but otherwise I wouldn't bother to visit just the caves. Also, there around 280 steps to get from the lower cave to the top cave... And of course an entrance fee for the caves

We visited multiple times to eat pastries and drink coffee. The pastries are so good, very authentically French. Mostly enjoyed because we've been travelling for 9 months at this point and they really hit the spot. Marked down a star because the coffees could be a bit bigger and improved. Still decent, but not the best.

Read some iffy reviews that made this place seem too expensive to be worth going. However we enjoyed two delicious and BIG espressos for 15000 kip each. And the sandwiches are definitely worth it. Not 15000 kip like on the streets but quality cheese and cured meats and candies tomatoes make it worth the 40000 kip! Good French wine for 3 dollars a glass, WOW. Super satisfied with the service as well, not so talkative but friendly and attentive. Definitely preferred their pastries to Zurich’s and the location is more relaxed and quiet. Best place so far in Luang Prabang.
So impressed with the Mediterranean plate.The bread is very good. Would highly recommend this spot. Prices aren't too different from nearby places.
Decent bakery, definitely hits the spot if you’re craving a fix of familiar pastries. Pretty much on a same level with any half-decent bakery in Europe.
Very nice pastries. The setting is also quiet in the afternoon, the main street is very quiet.

This restaurant is absolutely amazing!! I had the lamb Indian curry with wild sticky rice and for dessert I had homemade ice cream. Absolutely delicious! The quiet tucked away atmosphere was complimented by the servers that were so attentive and polite. I 100% recommend this restaurant. Lots of options to choose from, great service and yummy food - you simply can't go wrong!
This restaurant was amazing. My compliments to the chef. The service and food was exceptional. I can't wait to come back.
What a gem in the middle of Luang Prabang! Delicious food and excellent service. Prices are well above the average in the city, but totally worth it
Interesting food featuring insects. Slightly expensive. Excellent waitstaff.

Good place for family. Clean and great service. Offers a mix of local and western food. Nice location tucked away from the busy streets. We went in the off season at a out 18.00. We were the only ones there for an hour but that meant we got our own waiters. Friendly staff who constantly refill your drinks.
I just had the Lao coffee there, which was great. Nice and strong, served with sweetened condensed milk.
clean spacious beautiful cafe. good place to dine, chill and watch people go by

We came here a second time after lunch just to try their desserts and baguette.

The food is really good but can be pricey for South east Asia. I thought it was worth it just for the food alone. The baguette are freshly baked and insanely delicious, the baguette alone gets 5 stars. Desserts and the garlic baguette were pretty good as well.
Very good. Friendly service. A good varied menu.

Amazing place, great food, average prices, we got there at around noon, very refreshing vibe, coffee was strong and meticulously decorated top, from the noodles with red duck, great fresh noodles, savory crepes with ham and eggs, sweet crepes, and le grand set, I'm so happy we went to this cafe for lunch, four of us loved it, restroom was also clean and none smelling, attention from the server and co above average for Laos standard, location is pretty centric and convenient for the vicinity to hotels and shops.

Great food, great staff, great ambiance. Had the (huge!) vegan pizza that comes with fresh sunflower sprouts (my favorite!) The pizza really needs some garlic but other than that everything was great. Highly recommend.

the pizza blew me away! It was SO good! It was that good that i ordered another plate of pasta aglio olio. I’m Italian and I have to say that the food was almost that good like in Italy! The staff was so friendly. All in all it’s a place to go when u visit Luang Prabang.

It will feed you. That's it. Honnestly, there is many better places for pizza (Rosa, Phuang, ...). And pizza we got looked very different on the menu..
[results= 2,5/5]
Good food and staff :) especially pizza was great, even for my 5 year-old son!
Best pizza we had in southeast Asia hands down

Stopped here for a quick coffee and was impressed by the service, cleanliness and quality. Ordered a Piccolo latte using local beans from Chiang Rai and it was perfect. We could pay with card which was a bonus and the restaurant was nice and air conditioned. Best coffee experience in the city.

Price : relatively high in CM but reasonable.
Location : Near the eastern gate of the city. Easy to reach.
Food : Nice both of the taste and the outlook
Environment :nice I think it should be a nice place for dating.

OMG!  I'm totally in love with this place, not only the decoration, staff are nice with friendly smile always,  delicious food, reasonable price.  They have a nice shop here too.
You MUST come when you at Chiang Mai, highly recommend! 😍😍😍😍😍
Very nice dishes and service. The atmosphere was very nice as well.

Not as good as I had hoped, the staff and service was fantastic. But for what was my most expensive meal our so far in Thailand I was left quite underwhelmed, Tom Yum soup had no spice or body to it, the only good point where the three large prawns in there.

Nice coffee shop in the town center of Luang Prabang. They have a comfortable seating area, good coffee and drinks, and overall good service. The prices are also reasonable by local standards. It is a good place to go for a break from sightseeing around town.

Our first stop in LP as recommended by it's visibility in Google Maps and top cafe list in TRipAdvisor. Very nice place and space and good options for brunch. We tried the coconut cake which is their bestseller and it did not disappoint! Yummiest! The manager was incidentally Filipino so we also got a good chat while biding our time.
Wonderful place to take a break from the heat outside. Serves great food and pastries and drinks. Their chocolate cheesecake is a must try! One of the best I have tried!
Amazing place. Really tasty food! I ate there a few times the food was really good. And the service was really kind.

Delicious treat while in Luang Prabang! All the Western food you are craving while in SEA. First bagel and cream cheese I've had in Asia and I very much enjoyed the taste of home. Authentic coffee. Nice place to hang out.

Location? Check
Delicious food? Check
Friendly staff? Check

What else could you ask for? The reviews here speak for themselves and we are no exception. We got a little late from the airport and walked in to have lunch but the kitchen was already closed. However, they offered us snacks and drinks. The bagels were amazing, you got to try them!

What I really want to highlight is the business they put together, paying (they state) the best salaries in town, providing paid maternity, vacation and sick leaves, and other benefits to high school students that want to get work experience and earn their own money. At the same time we experienced how the owner guided the staff on how to do certain things or what things to highlight to the customers.

Very cozy place run by the owner and a great place to try out and sponsor.

We loved it here!  Ended up spending a few hours working, eating and drinking at Saffron.  Great seating and plenty of plugs, beautiful views of the river and delicious coffee/eats.  Love the information they provide on their local coffee suppliers!

Had cappuccino and the coffee tasted amazing. Highly recommended. 5 stars for the coffee. 
Only setback is the toilet. It was clean but the interior looked like belonged to those dodgy eateries, certainly didn't live up to the cafe beautifully furnished and decorated interior.

Love saffron coffee shop! Now that there are two cafes in Lang Prabang. The other one is called Saffron Alley while the main one is right by Mekong river. Coffee is good but love that I ordered ginger tea as I was feeling sick that day. The tea and the view of the river during sunset made me feel better. I also like that they are selling reusable cups.

I'm a coffee addict, sort of..., and always try to find nice little coffee shop everywhere I go (have been traveling a lot)
This place serves one of the best coffee I ever had. And it is well located.
Don't forget to buy a coffee tree to support the farmers community producing this superb coffee. It is cheep.
Love this cafe. Good coffee, good food and good atmosphere. They have seating right next to the river across the road from their cafe too. Great place to relax.

We got the Cuban and the classic smoked chicken sandwiches. They were pretty decently prepared. But they were too pricey. Considering that they cost LAK101000, and we had a couple of amazing meals at a very similar price at Bouang and Bamboo Tree Restaurants in town.

Decent coffee and decent quick ways. 

Service needs improvement. Would be nice if they cleaned tabletops more diligently. 

Count the change they give you. Shady mathematics here...
Good relaxing evening dinner .Service has improved and their staffs are friendly. Would recommend to friends.

This business in Vientiane is booming but in Luang Prabang the only lady who seems to understand how to offer a simple smile, greeting to customers was the young lady there. The older ladies literally scowl, growl as they work? With 2 coffee shops, bakeries near by, they should learn simple customer service practices!

Not the largest place but has a number of options. The burgers have a fast food frozen feel to them but the fresh choices are good. The "make it yourself" sandwich deal is one of my favourites. Seating outside will let you watch the people going past.
